venue.name: Blue Meadows Hall
venue.address_1: Blue meadows, Basesment, University of Benin

venue.name: Blue Meadows Hall
venue.address_1: Blue meadows, Basesment, University of Benin

name: Cloud Study Jam Benin
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

name: Mobile Sites Certification
description: We shall have an introduction to the Mobile sites certification program from Google and run through the training on Mobile Sites as provided by the Academy for Ads by Google.We shall also introduce Mobile Site Specific design processes and procedures to our community of website developers in GDG Benin who are in Benson Idahosa Universityto help them design better Mobile efficient websites.

name: WTM Explore
description:
WTM Explore, is an initiative of Women Techmakers Benin, that seeks to address gender imbalance in technology roles in Benin City.

The aim is to foster an inclusive development environment where women in tech, can be themselves and do their best work. It is also about creating the right environment – an environment filled with exciting challenges that require innovative solutions so women can share their ideas, thoughts and perspectives to build the best ideas for competitive success. In view of this, we seek to unearth the best talents from individuals with the right kind of ambition and character suitable for these roles. See further details below:

*Date for the Meetup is 17th March, 2018*

*Venue - 500 level Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, University of Benin.*

Everyone *(males inclusive)* interested in leveraging the benefits of technology via different platforms, is invited. For more information about Women Techmakers, visit www.WomenTechmakers.com

name: IWD 2018, Benin City

venue.name: Banquet Hall, Basement building, University of Benin

description:
• What we'll do

We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference that will highlight the stories and accomplishments of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs, especially those who have been able to thrive in the tech world despite being in a developing country like Nigeria

There would be lots of exciting learning opportunities (tech and non-tech areas), code competition/product design challenge and talk sessions facilitated by experienced speakers.

Also, there would be lots of Google customized swags to take home.

Please invite your friends (Males and Females).

• What to bring: Come along with a heart ready to learn and your notepads, laptops e.t.c
how_to_find_us: Ask for basement or Blue Meadows

name: Build Actions on Google
description:
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we are inviting the whole developer community to learn about creating applications for the Google Assistant. Build Actions for Your Community is an open and modular event series designed by Google to learn how to build applications for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, you can build something in an area that they care about or are interested in.

• What to bring
Laptops, Notepads

name: I/O 2018 Extended Benin

venue.name: Banquet Hall, Basement building, University of Benin

description:
• What we'll do
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

This years I/O Extended will also feature Machine Learning and an introduction to Flutter Session as well as mentoring sessions from two awesome speakers who have gone far in the Tech World and started right here tell their story.

• What to bring
Laptops, Notepads

name: DevFest 2018 Benin
description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

It is the biggest Tech Conference from Google and fosters collaboration between chapters and developers alike.

name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: South South Hub
venue.address_1: I.C.E Off Wire Road, Benin City, Edo State

description:
Come and Learn Flutter for hybrid mobile apps development. Develop your Android and iOS app from one codebase. Fun. Isn't it? Sign Up for our Flutter Study Jam and develop the right skills you based on Udacity's Flutter Course.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

Requirements
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
Remember the event is free

name: Cloud Study Jam Benin

venue.name: South South Hub
venue.address_1: I.C.E Off Wire Road, Benin City, Edo State

description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
